standard_metadata.standard_description: Add, subtract, multiply, and divide decimals to hundredths, using concrete models or drawings and strategies based on place value, properties of operations, and/or the relationship between addition and subtraction; relate the strategy to a written method and explain the reasoning used.

hints.content: There are many ways to solve this problem. Let's see two ways we can solve it.
###Place Value  We can think in terms of hundredths:  $\begin{align} &\phantom{=}0.86- 0.25\\\\ &=86\text{ hundredths} - 25\text{ hundredths}\\\\ &=61\text{ hundredths}\\\\ &=0.61 \end{align}$

###Place Value Grids  We can use hundredths grids:  $\blueE{0.86}  =$  [[☃ image 1]]  $ \maroonD{0.25} =$ [[☃ image 2]]  $\blueE{0.86} - \maroonD{0.25} = $ [[☃ image 3]]  $\blueE{0.86} - \maroonD{0.25} = 0.61$

images.alt: A square divided into 100 equally-sized smaller squares to represent hundredths. 86 squares are shaded and 14 squares are not shaded.
A square divided into 100 equally-sized smaller squares to represent hundredths. 25 squares are shaded and 75 squares are not shaded.

A square divided into 100 equally-sized smaller squares to represent hundredths. 86 of the squares are shaded. 25 of the shaded squares have been crossed out. 61 shaded squares remain without being crossed out. The other 14 squares are unshaded.

hints.content: We can change $\blueE{90}$ hundredths into tenths.  [[☃ image 1]]  $\blueE{90\text { hundredths}}$ is equal to $\blueE{9\text { tenths}}$:  $\blueE{0.90}=\blueE{0.9}$

###Place Value  We can think in terms of hundredths:  $\begin{align} &\phantom{=}0.4-0.33\\\\ &=4\text{ tenths} - 33\text{ hundredths}\\\\ &=40\text{ hundredths} - 33\text{ hundredths}\\\\ &=7\text{ hundredths}\\\\ &=0.07 \end{align}$

###Place Value Grids  We can use hundredths grids:  $\blueE{0.4} =$ [[☃ image 1]]  $\maroonD{0.33}=$ [[☃ image 2]]  $\blueE{0.40} - \maroonD{0.33}=$  [[☃ image 3]]  $\blueE{0.4} - \maroonD{0.33} = 0.07$
